commentary.text: Sehwag and Manan Vohra to open. Bhuvneshwar with the new ball
Kumar to Sehwag, $$FOUR$$ ,Sehwag goes for it first ball, a full delivery coming into him, mid on is far up in the circle, and he lofts it just over him
Kumar to Sehwag, $$OUT$$ ,he's gone for it second ball as well, straightish delivery, pitched up, he tries to lift it over the bowler, and toe-ends it tamely to Bhuvneshwar
Paul: "Sunrisers finally posting a score much on line with their batting prowess ,Great innings from Ojha,hope the bowling comes to party. "
Kumar to Saha,no run,leans forward and pushes firmly to extra cover, who dives and prevents the single
Kumar to Saha,no run,a length ball on off stump, he comes forward and pushes it back
Kumar to Saha,no run,punches a good length ball to point
Zaheer: "Naman was not selected for three games. That tells you how bad SRH selection was at the start of IPL. Batting order is another issue."
Kumar to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,boundary to start the over, and boundary to end it, Bhuvneshwar goes full outside off, and Saha lofts it in the gap between extra cover and mid off
Dale Steyn
Neeraj : "Very poor from Bailey to send Saha in now."
Steyn to Vohra,no run,starts with a length ball on off, Vohra stays on the crease and plays it back
Lakshminarayana: "Great Start by Bhuvneshwar as usual. Waiting to see Maxwell how he deals with Bhuvneshwar & Steyn threat."
Steyn to Vohra,3 runs,Vohra is away in his first game of the season as he pulls high in the air over square leg, and the ball plonks down before the rope
Steyn to Saha,2 runs,Saha goes over extra cover now, ends up slicing it high, but well clear of the infield
Steyn to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,as clean as it gets now, as Saha pulls off the front foot, well in front of square
Steyn to Saha,1 leg bye,hit on the pad and Steyn appeals, Saha trots out, the lob from point misses, they take the overthrow, it jagged in and hit him above the knee roll, was also likely going down
Steyn to Vohra, $$SIX$$ ,Steyn drops it short yet again in the over, and this time Vohra gets hold of the pull, and it flies over the deep midwicket boundary
Kumar to Saha,2 runs,they're hitting everything in the air, Saha now pulls a length ball over midwicket, and it falls in vacant space
Kumar to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,Saha clears the infield once more, this time off side, waits on this length ball outside off and lifts it over cover
Kumar to Saha,no run,Bhuvneshwar goes full, Saha digs it back, trots out, bowler throws it back, misses, even as Saha scurries back
Kumar to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,four more, over mid on now as Saha steps out and swats a back of a length ball

Kumar to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,they hit one along the ground, but it is the same result, despite there being a long off in place, he dives too, in vain, as Saha sends this full delivery scorching across the turf with a classy drive
Kumar to Saha,1 run,full again, clipped to deep midwicket
Raghu Ifmr: "Punjab batsmen in Maxwell mode.."
Henriques to Saha,no run,a slower one on off, pushed down the track
Henriques to Saha, $$SIX$$ ,Saha is playing a blinder, he comes down the track to a length ball, moves leg side a bit, and lofts over long off, into the crowd
Vignesh S: "Horrible day for swing bowlers!!"
Henriques to Saha,1 run,a short ball angled into the right hander, Saha tries to work it square, can only get one as it goes close to the pitch
Henriques to Vohra, $$FOUR$$ ,superbly done, Vohra brings 50 up as he opens the face to a slower one and beats short third man
Henriques to Vohra, $$FOUR$$ ,four more, now he moves across to off and tucks a short of a length ball behind square leg, too much work for the man in the deep, he gives up
Henriques to Vohra,1 run,back of a length again, outside off, dabbed to third man
Karn Sharma
Sharma to Vohra,1 run,drives a tossed up full ball to extra cover
Sharma to Saha,no run,he's backed away and creamed this length ball, cover's overreached to his left but he manages to stop it in the end
Sharma to Saha,1 run,forced off a thick inside edge through midwicket
Sharma to Vohra,1 run,turned off the pad to deep midwicket
Sharma to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,Vohra skips out now, he is really not to the pitch, but he's well inside the line as he lofts over extra cover
Sharma to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,he drags it short down the pads, and Vohra pulls it behind square for four more
PeterA: "Sorry.. whats going on? Five minutes away from the desk and there is a jolt!"
Henriques to Vohra, $$FOUR$$ ,full and wide, Vohra goes after it, and thick-edges it between the keeper and short third man
Piyush: "It seems like a wicket keepers day today. First Ojha and now Saha."
Henriques to Vohra, $$FOUR$$ ,this has almost gone for six, what was Vohra doing on the bench all this time, gets front foot out of the way and drills this full delivery over mid off
Henriques to Vohra,1 run,comes across to a full one on off and works it to long on
Henriques to Saha, $$SIX$$ ,Saha's pummeled this slower back of a length ball for six, he's waited on it and slashed it over point
Henriques to Saha, $$FOUR$$ ,50 off 22 for Saha, back of a length again and he makes sure to beat midwicket comfortably with the pull
Henriques to Saha,1 run,makes room and looks to go over the off side, but drags it in the air through midwicket instead
Doc: "This was meant to be the Maxwell Miller what?!"
Saravanakumar: "Now we know why Punjab retained Manan Vohra"
Required rate down to eight and a half
Mishra to Saha,1 run,some turn on the flighted ball for Mishra on middle, it is worked in front of square
Mishra to Vohra,1 run,well bowled, he tosses it up outside off, it is the googly, spins in sharply, he jabs it towards short third man
Mishra to Saha,1 run,pulled to deep midwicket
Mishra to Vohra,no run,another flighted googly, he makes room but is cramped, punches it to cover
Mishra to Vohra,2 runs,punched through midwicket, they take on Warner and go for the second, and make it
Mishra to Vohra, $$FOUR$$ ,goes fuller this time and is slog swept from just outside off stump, the ball beats deep midwicket easily

Sharma to Saha, $$OUT$$ ,Saha's gone now, he's more than done his job though, comes out to a length delivery on middle and leg, is nowhere near the pitch as it dips, and then turns sharply to set up a simple stumping
Maxwell is in
Sharma to Maxwell,no run,pushes a full delivery and bowlers stops it well
Sharma to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,Maxwell warms up second ball with a powerful slog sweep that brings up the fastest team hundred in the IPL with a six over deep midwicket
Sharma to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,six more, this is a monster, Karn drags it flatter and shorter on middle, Maxwell goes back in the crease and pulls it 93 metres into the crowd over deep midwicket
Round the stumps
Sharma to Maxwell,no run,beaten on the slog sweep as this spins across him from outside leg
Sharma to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,back to normal again with the third six of the over with another almighty connection of a slog sweep
Steyn is back
Steyn to Vohra,2 runs,a slower length ball on off, it is nudged to vacant midwicket and they have taken two more
Steyn to Vohra,no run,beaten as he flashes at an away going and climbing length ball outside off
Steyn to Vohra,2 runs,pegged deep in the crease by this sharp back of a length ball, squirts it behind point, and they get two more, the leak is just not stopping for Sunrisers
Steyn to Vohra, $$SIX$$ ,Steyn goes short and slow, and Vohra powers him over deep midwicket for six more
Steyn to Vohra,1 run,opens the face and runs this back of a length ball to third man, that just flew off the bat
Steyn to Maxwell,1 leg bye,Steyn pings in a furious bouncer, Maxwell tries to get out of the way but it hits him on the shoulder, and pops up to the right of the keeper
Sagar Pasad: "Vohra and Saha were the thunderstorm before the Maxwell Cyclone"
Raghu Ifmr: "Seems like KXIP were keeping Vohra as a surprise. What a great mix of smartness and aggression. Awesome stuff.."
yasir: "this is getting ridiculous... Maxwell should play with some sort of handicap.... "

Kumar to Maxwell, $$OUT$$ ,probably this was the only they could have got a wicket, Maxwell pushes it down the track, bowler gets his fingers to it, and Vohra's bat is in the air as he looks to come back, gone
Vohra has stayed on the bench all this while, he opens in a 200-plus chase, and swats 47 off 20. Some innings
Kumar to Maxwell,1 run,very full from Bhuvneshwar again, Maxwell leans forward and jabs it down to long on
Kumar to Miller,no run,a good length ball from round the wicket, Miller is forward to defend
Kumar to Miller,1 run,leans across and pushes a length ball on off to long on to get off the mark
Kumar to Maxwell,no run,that kept very low and rolled to the keeper as he missed the cut
Kumar to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,nicely done, Maxwell opens the face to this full one outside off and squirts it between the keeper and short third man
Mishra to Miller,1 run,short of a length, spinning in a tad, pulled to deep midwicket

Mishra to Maxwell,1 no ball,they have the big one, Maxwell's tried to pull another six, it was a flat delivery from round the wicket, and he skies it around mid on, Steyn runs across from the off side, bowler is close by, but the fast bowler takes it, but wait...  $$Mishra$$ $$has$$ $$bowled$$ $$a$$ $$no-ball$$ , there is nothing behind the line, so Maxwell stays
Over the stumps
Mishra to Miller,2 runs,Miller steps out and sends it soaring miles, it comes down to deep midwicket and is put down, was the free hit anyway
Mishra to Miller,1 run,full one clipped off the pad to Steyn at wide long on, Miller wants a second, is sent back
Round the stumps
Mishra to Maxwell, $$FOUR$$ ,how does he do it? this is a low full toss going across him, he bends the knee, leans forward and reverse sweeps over short third man's jump
Mishra to Maxwell,no run,out of nowhere, he leans into a proper forward defensive now
Mishra to Maxwell,1 run,a calm push to deep midwicket to end the over
Karn from round the stumps
Sharma to Maxwell,1 run,goes back to a tossed up ball pitching well outside leg and works it square
Sharma to Miller,1 run,clips off the pad to deep square leg
Sharma to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,they can't contain him even if they bowl outside leg, Maxwell steps out and drags it just over the deep midwicket boundary
Sharma to Maxwell, $$SIX$$ ,the slog-sweep once more, this is more in his hitting zone, pitched up straight delivery on leg, and he wallops it over square leg
Sharma to Maxwell,no run,pitching outside leg and hitting him on the pad as he stays in the crease
Sharma to Maxwell,1 run,pushed to vacant midwicket for a single
Arul Sankar: "Are these guys chasing 205 or 105? This Chase looks very simple..!! Awesome stuff..!!!!"

Steyn to Maxwell,no run,bowls it full around off, Maxwell digs it straight back to the bowler, Steyn puts up a hand in appeal for a catch, they go to the third umpire, replays show that was toe-ended into the ground before it popped up to Steyn
Abhishek: "To be eligible to play in the KXIP team you need to have a strike rate of 200 or more!!!!"

Steyn to Maxwell,1 run,mid off is up, Warner fields this drive, does not have a go at the stumps even though he threatens to, as the batsmen are almost home by that time, Maxwell runs all the way up to Warner, both have a smile on
Steyn to Miller,no run,pushes forward to a length ball on middle, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
Steyn to Miller,2 runs,a sharp bouncer on off, Miller stands up to it and pulls it just past midwicket, long on runs around
Steyn to Miller,no run,full goes Steyn, Miller digs it out to extra cover
Steyn to Miller,no run,comes outside his crease, but gets an inside edge onto pad

Mishra to Maxwell, $$OUT$$ ,the batsman, bowler and fielder combination is the same again, and this time, Maxwell has to go, he's stepped out to a tossed up legbreak, he is not to the pitch, it has spun away from him, and he has skied it for Steyn to settle under it at long off
Slip in
Mishra to Miller,no run,tossed up googly pushed off the front foot to the off side
Mishra to Miller, $$FOUR$$ ,another googly, Miller's lunged forward and reverse swept it past backward point
Mishra to Miller,1 run,yet another googly, Miller goes across and forces it to deep midwicket
Mishra to Bailey,1 run,walks across to off and nudges a legbreak to midwicket for a single
Mishra to Miller,1 run,Mishra ends the over with a bouncing googly outside off, Miller cuts it to the sweeper
Ridhuvarshan: "That awkward moment when you find out Maxwell has the least strike rate among all batsmen who got out"
Sharma to Miller,1 leg bye,legbreak straightens and hits him high on the pad, they scamper a single as the ball goes square on the off side
Sharma to Bailey,no run,wants to work it to square leg, but it hits pad high again and pops up close to the crease
Sharma to Bailey,no run,Bailey struggling in search of the tuck to square leg, cannot get it away again
Sharma to Bailey,no run,steps out uncertainly and pushes it straight to the bowler
Sharma to Bailey,1 run,finally gets off strike as he forces it down to long on
Sharma to Miller,1 run,steps out, Karn angles it across short, Miller slaps it wide of the sweeper
Mishra to Miller,no run,swats a googly straight to extra covre
Mishra to Miller,1 run,comes down the track to another turning googly and hits it in the air to long off
Mishra to Bailey,no run,flat on middle and off, Bailey comes out but cannot beat short midwicket with the tuck
Mishra to Bailey,2 runs,fortunate for Bailey, he comes across and has a go at this full delivery, thick edge goes inches over Karn at backward point
Mishra to Bailey,1 run,flighted googly coming in to off, dabbed to short third man
Mishra to Miller,2 runs,neatly done, softly works it off the pad in front of square, and by the time the deep fielder runs in, they take the second
Irfan to bowl
Pathan to Bailey,1 run,starts with a length ball on off and is worked wide of deep midwicket, they want the second but Bailey slips as he turns, and they settle for one
Pathan to Miller,1 run,full ball on middle, clipped through midwicket, they are not even going to attempt the second against Warner as he races to his left from long on
Pathan to Bailey,no run,Bailey is stuck on the crease to a length ball on middle and knocks it back to Irfan
Pathan to Bailey,no run,shout for leg before as Bailey swipes and misses, but that pitched outside leg, Bailey wants a single, Karn advances from point, had he hit, Bailey was out by miles

Pathan to Bailey,1 run,this game is still not done, Warner pulls off a stunner, Bailey feels the pressure to try a big shot, completely mishits it, Warner advances from long off, he dives forward, they decide to check if it is clean, does he have his fingers under the ball as he takes it, has it touched the ground, can't really be sure with replays, and the benefit goes to the batsman
Pathan to Miller,2 runs,makes room and scythes a full toss to sweeper cover
Read this on the subject of  $$low$$ $$catches$$
Steyn to Bailey,1 run,Bailey continues to survive, direct hit was needed from extra cover as he pushed and ran, not coming, he was gone had it hit
Chat between Dhawan, Finch and Steyn
Steyn to Miller,1 run,a thick inside edge to short fine leg as Miller swings at a pitched up ball around middle and leg
Steyn to Bailey, $$SIX$$ ,Bailey's finally got something away, it is angled in full to leg stump, Bailey gets front leg out of the way and lifts it over wide long on
Steyn to Bailey, $$FOUR$$ ,four more, Steyn goes full and outside off now, Bailey looking a lot better now as he bends the back leg and square drives to the backward point boundary
Steyn to Bailey, $$FOUR$$ ,he's making up for his struggle, Steyn pitches it up close to off, Bailey gets forward and smashes it over extra cover
Steyn to Bailey, $$SIX$$ ,what a turnaround from Bailey, Steyn bowls a slower length ball on middle and leg, Bailey cracks it straight and high over the bowler
Not the best over from Steyn that
Kumar to Miller,1 run,drills a full delivery to long off
Kumar to Bailey,1 run,dabs a slower length ball to short third man
Kumar to Miller,1 run,short outside off, Miller drags a pull to midwicket
Kumar to Bailey, $$SIX$$ ,Bhuvneshwar goes full outside off, and Bailey finishes it with a flat six that lands just over the long off boundary
Hop over  $$here$$  to follow KKR v MI. That is all from this game. Good bye

Wriddhiman Saha is the Man of the Match. Saha: "Me and Manan were thinking of scoring as much as possible in first six overs and keeping the momentum going. He (Vohra) is outstanding, timing the ball properly. Good pitch, 400 runs in 40 overs."

Bailey: "I walked off at the half way point angry at our bowlers. Maybe we bowled okay, I am not sure. Saha and Manan were outstanding. Really pleasing thing was it looked calculated, did not like they were slogging or taking everything on, they were really good cricket shots, it gave the rest of the guys the confidence that it was a chaseable total. At the halfway stage, I was thinking if it was one of those ones where I would be asked if we toss again, if I would change it. It just skids on a little bit, it did feel like it was coming on quite nicely (batting second), but it felt like it was coming on nicely all day. You get the first one away and you get some confidence I guess. We are not relying overly on Maxwell and Miller, though they have had a fantastic series. Other guys are contributing, which is important."

Kings XI have been asked to chase 200-plus twice this season, and they have done it successfully both times. And by the time Maxwell came in today, Kings XI were 95 for 2 in 7.1 overs. Credit to Saha and Vohra, playing his first game of the season. The win puts Kings XI in relatively safe territory, they have eight now

Sunjay: "Almost a vintage super kings-esque chase. Quick start, busy middle, and captain comes, struggles a bit, but stays in there to finish the game with a six. They've evolved a super kings model with an inform maxi-miller combo too."
Ozee: "Firstly It was ABD against steyn and now its Bailey....steyn is definitely under the pump."

name: Sunrisers Hyderabad v Kings XI Punjab
